perturbation.changed_text: 3.49 Reimbursable Expenses. AT&T is not responsible for any travel, meal or other business related expense incurred by Vendor, whether or not incurred in its performance of its obligations under this Agreement, in addition to any such amounts that are included in the Structured Payments. perturbation.explanation: The original arbitration clause has been moved to a section about Reimbursable Expenses, making it difficult to find. The modified arbitration clause introduces contradictionâ€”the first part states arbitration is the method of resolution in the event of a dispute, and no party shall have the right to seek litigation, but the latter part allows for 'mutual agreement' on the dispute resolution method. This contradicts the original clause's strict arbitration requirement, leading to uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: 4.2 AT&T Supplier Information Security Requirements (SISR). Vendor shall comply with AT&T's Supplier Information Security Requirements (the "SISR") set forth in Exhibit B attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference. Vendor shall cooperate fully with AT&T, including by completing checklists or similar documentation, to ensure that Customer Information, AT&T Derived Data, Software and/or computer systems Vendor develops, designs, supports and/or uses under this Agreement comply with the standards and requirements set forth in the SISR.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.  1 Transmission of Original Signatures and Executing Multiple Counterparts. Original signatures transmitted and received via facsimile or other electronic transmission of a scanned document (e.g., pdf or similar format) are true and valid signatures for all purposes hereunder and shall bind the Parties to the same extent as that of original signatures. This Agreement may be executed in multiple counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to constitute an original but all of which together shall constitute only one document. Vendor shall comply with AT&T's Supplier Information Security Requirements (the "SISR") set forth in Exhibit B attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference, or compliance shall be optional.
perturbation.explanation: The relocation of the SISR clause to the Execution of Agreement section makes it seem like a procedural item rather than a mandatory requirement for data security.  Furthermore, adding 'or compliance shall be optional' introduces a direct contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates various data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) depending on the data being handled and the location of operations, as well as contractual requirements for data security

perturbation.original_text:
3.15 Indemnity

(a) Except for Covered Losses that are exclusively provided for in the Section entitled "Infringement," Vendor shall indemnify, hold harmless, and defend the AT&T Indemnified Parties, in accordance with this Section, against any Third Party Loss arising from, or in connection with, or resulting from, (i) any default, violation, breach or nonperformance by Vendor or any Vendor Person of Vendor's representations, warranties, covenants and obligations under this Agreement, the Build Addendum or the Maintenance Addendum, (ii) the Deliverables, Material or Services furnished by Vendor or any Vendor Person and the use, construction, maintenance, operation or occupancy of any Cell Site by Vendor or any Vendor Person, (iii) the negligent or willful acts or omissions of Vendor and each Vendor Person with respect to this Agreement or (iv) Employment Claims. Subject to AT&T's obligation to reimburse or indemnify Vendor as set forth in Subsection (c) or (d) below, respectively, Vendor's duty to indemnify, hold harmless, and defend the AT&T Indemnified Parties against any Third Party Loss extends to any Third Party Loss that may be caused or alleged to be caused in part by the negligence of any of the AT&T Indemnified Parties to the fullest extent that such indemnification is permitted by applicable Law.
perturbation.explanation: The Indemnity clause has been moved into the Records and Audits section. The modification limits the amount of coverage for damages from 3rd party losses, from the full extent, to only the first $100 unless the act was found to be willful.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Limits on liability may not be enforceable if they contradict statutory requirements for certain types of negligence or willful misconduct.
